lead_paragraph: A nation anxiously searches for ways to feed itself, as the economic collapse of recent years has left it unable to produce or import sufficient food.

byline.contributor: Meridith Kohut contributed reporting from Cumaná, and Ana Vanessa Herrero and María Eugenia Díaz from Caracas, Venezuela.

headline.print_headline: Pillaging by Venezuelans Reveals Depth of Hunger
headline.main: Venezuelans Ransack Stores as Hunger Grips the Nation

snippet: A nation anxiously searches for ways to feed itself, as the economic collapse of recent years has left it unable to produce or import sufficient food.
abstract: Venezuelans are in throes of hunger as food shortages, due to economic chaos, worsen; more than 50 food riots, protests and looting episodes have occurred in recent weeks, with 87 percent of citizens saying they do not have enough money to buy what little food is being produced.
